channel.title: Hey guys check out new commands---hey there not working?!?!?
channel.description: hello i just opened my new server swintell v2 and I have a problem I am using runescape 3 source and ive added commands and it has members ect but wen i make command or already ones there make them were players can do them....only admins or owners can do all....and they say player rights 0 and mods cant do wen it says player rigth 1..... now i made a rules menu but i can only open it......can some one help me?

item.title: Hey guys check out new commands---hey there not working?!?!?
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:20, topic:151131”]dude…ive already made my own server from scratch. i have all the commands that i could POSSIBLY need. and i made mine so that they dont need to be in the client to work.

ANYWAYS, if you want me to try to fix them, post an example of the entire code of 1 command that doesnt work.[/quote]

I really highly doubt you wrote every single file. Lol… Nice, you good with commands. What did you add, ::adminzone ? LLAWL

item.title: Hey guys check out new commands---hey there not working?!?!?
item.dc:creator: @Baybee Baybee
item.description:
@Baybee wrote:

Tell you what. Add this in your client.java. Make backups though.

public int checkmods() { try { BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./data/moderators.txt")); String data = null; while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) { if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) { return 5; } } } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("Critical error while checking moderators.!"); e.printStackTrace(); } return 0; } public int checkadmins() { try { BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./data/administrators.txt")); String data = null; while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) { if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) { return 5; } } } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("Critical error while checking administrators!"); e.printStackTrace(); } return 0; } public int checkstaff() { try { BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./data/staff.txt")); String data = null; while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) { if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) { return 5; } } } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("Critical error while checking staff!"); e.printStackTrace(); } return 0; }

checkmods(); checkadmins(); checkstaff(); if(checkmods() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("")) playerRights = 1; if(checkadmins() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("")) playerRights = 2; if(checkstaff() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Baybee")) playerRights = 3;

Then at the end of all your commands, put < 4.
Hope that really helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Hey guys check out new commands---hey there not working?!?!?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Find the Command And at the end of the command it will have

&& (playerRights >= 0))
&& (playerRights >= 1))
&& (playerRights >= 2))
&& (playerRights >= 3))

Change the 0, 1 , 2 or 3 To what You want … 0 Is Regular Players , 1 Is Mods , 2 Admins , 3 Owner

Also make sure you Compiler is Working.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Baybee Baybee
item.description:
@Baybee wrote:

Your commands change it to players rights 2 then.
For your rules menu, before your rules menu add this.

public void RulesMenu() {

Then add the command at command place.

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("rules")) { readRules = true; RulesMenu();

Hope that helped.
